result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan James Whitcomb

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:37 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Ryan James Whitcomb in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel in court for Ryan James Whitcomb.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Rypel provides an update; he still needs time to review discovery and the offer with his client.  Atty. Rypel requests another further proceedings date in about 45 days.  State takes no position.  Court also notes there is a WCS non-compliance report and reviews it on the record.  Defendant presents statements with respect to the non-compliance.  Court admonishes the defendant and reminds him he must comply with all conditions of bail including WCS monitoring, future failure to comply could lead to bail being increased and/or the defendant being taken into custody.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/7/22 received and filed.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - will be addressed at next hearing**
Hearing on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:47 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Ryan James Whitcomb in court.  Attorney Stephen P. Rypel appeared by Zoom video for Ryan James Whitcomb.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Rypel provides an update, he filed a discovery demand but is waiting to verify he has all of the discovery.  Atty. Rypel requests another further proceedings in about 6-8 weeks.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Defense Counsel's Motion to Allow Remote Appearance filed by Atty. Rypel. **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen, on behalf of Branch 7, 08/30/22 - Approved by zoom or phone if zoom is not in use.**
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Filed by Atty. Rypel.

08:46 AM Defendant Ryan James Whitcomb appeared by Zoom with attorney Stephen P. Rypel who appeared by Zoom.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: 11:20 AM Defendant Ryan James Whitcomb in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court denies request.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  If the defendant has an attorney, the Court will authorize the defendant to appear by Zoom.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.
